title: How to improve raised beds and a tip for autumn hedges, by garden expert Helen Yemm
text:
Every week, Telegraph gardening expert Helen Yemm gives tips and advice on all your gardening problems whether at home or on the allotment. If you have a question, see below for how to contact her.

A raised bed with rooty, sandy soil

I have made a raised bed with wooden sleeper sides in a sunny spot of garden for vegetables. The soil within it (currently barely “raised” at all) is light and sandy, and somewhat invaded by the fibrous roots of next door’s holly tree.

Shall I raise the height of the sides of the bed to give more depth, and/or should I line its floor with something porous to prevent the roots invading?

Isobel Wilkinson – via email
